answers.junior: Dependency injection means providing objects their dependencies instead of creating them internally. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
answers.middle: DI is a design pattern where container provides dependencies to objects, promoting loose coupling. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Types include constructor, setter, and field injection.
answers.senior: DI inverts control by externalizing dependency creation and wiring. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Enables testability, modularity, and configuration flexibility. Prefer constructor injection for required dependencies.
answers.tricky: Discuss circular dependencies, lazy initialization, optional dependencies, qualifiers, and injection performance implications. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
